page.title: 10Lifestyles, Eccleston
page.content: Surveys conducted within Eccleston County Primary School's 210 pupils give some indication of the way-of-life of the families from which they come. More than one third have a home micro-computer. About one third have a video recorder. Only two children have grandparents living with them, as part of the family. About one quarter live near enough to grandparents to visit them without adult supervision. About half have two parents at work. About half have travelled outside the British Isles by aeroplane. More than half come from 2-child families; only 5% are single children. The largest families have five children, and only two are represented in school.
